question.questionA: Stems and leaves glandular hairy.
question.questionB: Stems and leaves not glandular hairy.

question.questionA: Stems winged.
question.questionB: Stems not winged.

question.questionA: Leaflets with parallel veins.
question.questionB: Leaflets pinnately veined.

question.questionA: Calyx teeth all equal, at least twice as long as the calyx tube.
question.questionB: At least two calyx teeth less than twice as long as the calyx tube.

question.questionA: Calyx teeth leafy; stipules more than 2 cm.
question.questionB: Calyx teeth not leafy; stipules less than 2 cm.

question.questionA: Style hairy on the upper side only.
question.questionB: Style hairless, hairy all round or hairy on the lower side only.

question.questionA: Flowers yellow.
question.questionB: Flowers purple, pink, violet or white.

question.questionA: Stems  wingless;  leaves  replaced  by  tendrils;  stipules  hastate much longer than petioles; flowers bright yellow.
question.questionB: Stems winged, at least in the upper portion; stipules much shorter than petioles.

question.questionA: Stems and petioles broadly winged throughout; lower leaves replacedby tendrils; flowers pale yellow.
question.questionB: Upper  portions  of  stems  slightly winged; lower pair of leaflets prominent, grass-like, remaining leaflets replaced by tendrils; flowers bright yellow.

question.questionA: Leaves simple or leaflets two.
question.questionB: Leaflets four to twelve.

question.questionA: Stem wingless or with a wing less than 1 mm wide.
question.questionB: Stem broadly winged, wing more than 2 mm wide.

question.questionA: Annuals; flowers solitary.
question.questionB: Perennials; flowers in axillary racemes.

question.questionA: Small annual; stem wingless;  leaves with two pairs of leaflets; leaflets on lower leaves ending in three prominent teeth, leaflets on upper leaves narrowly linear; tendrils absent; flowers pale blue or yellow/blue
question.questionB: Annuals; stems winged; leaves with two or more pairs of leaflets and ending  in  tendrils;  standard petal   crimson,  laterals  and keel   lilac or white.

question.questionA: Lateral and keel petals lilac. Pod with channelled dorsal suture.
question.questionB: Lateral and keel petals white. Pod with unchannelled dorsal suture.

question.questionA: Stipules entire; flowers white with blue veins; calyx teeth up to six times the length of the calyx tube.
question.questionB: Stipules dentate; flowers pale lilac; calyx teeth up to four times the length of the tube.

question.questionA: Inflorescences  usually  of more  than  six  flowers; peduncles usually longer than leaves.
question.questionB: Inflorescences usually of fewer than six flowers; peduncles much  shorter than leaves.

question.questionA: Flowers 2-9 mm; inflorescences one- to nine-flowered.
question.questionB: Flowers 1-2 cm; inflorescences six- to thirty-flowered.

question.questionA: Leaflets four to eight pairs; leaves ending in branched tendrils
question.questionB: Leaflets ten to thirteen pairs; leaves ending in a short bristle.

question.questionA: Leaflets two to five pairs; inflorescences one- to five-flowered.
question.questionB: Leaflets six to twenty pairs; inflorescences ten- to forty-flowered.

question.questionA: Flowers violet, purple or blue, all opening at the same time; calyx with a boss-like swelling at the base; fruit hairless.
question.questionB: Flowers red, the  lateral   petals with dark purple tips, opening at different times; calyx without swelling at the base; fruit hairy.

question.questionA: Flowers predominantly yellow or white.
question.questionB: Flowers predominantly lilac, violet or purple.

question.questionA: Inflorescence of two to six flowers; flowers 2 cm, white; leaflets one to three pairs; tendrils absent; pod 5-30 cm.
question.questionB: Flowers  solitary,  pale  yellow;  leaflets  normally  eight  pairs;  tendrils present; pod 2-3 cm.

question.questionA: Peduncles and pedicels absent or very short; calyx teeth more or less equal, as long as calyx tube; stipules often dentate, bearing a dark spot.
question.questionB: Racemes more  than half  the  length of  the  leaves; stipules lobed or entire.

question.questionA: Keel petal dark-tipped; calyx teeth more or less equal, exceeding the length of the calyx tube.
question.questionB: Keel petal  not dark-tipped;  calyx  teeth unequal,  some  shorter  than calyx tube.

question.questionA: Leaflets two to three pairs; corolla 16-20 mm.
question.questionB: Leaflets four to six pairs; corolla 4-8 mm.

question.questionA: Plants glabrous; calyx teeth unequal all shorter than calyx tube.
question.questionB: Plants sparsely pubescent; lower calyx teeth equalling or exceeding calyx tube.
